title: Reading Basics
description: Learn letters, phonics, and simple words

content.introduction: This lesson introduces letters and sounds using a multi-sensory approach: seeing, hearing, saying, and tracing each letter.
objectives: Identify upper- and lowercase letters Aâ€“Z
Match each letter with its primary sound
Blend simple consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words
Read a short decodable sentence with support
activities: Alphabet song with pointer or laser on each letter
Letter-sound flashcards and echo reading
Build CVC words using letter tiles
Read and illustrate a one-sentence mini-story

title: Science Exploration
description: Discover the world around you through fun experiments

content.introduction: Young scientists will explore simple experiments that show how we use our senses and make observations.
objectives: Use the five senses to make observations
Ask simple questions about the world around us
Record observations with pictures or tally marks
Understand that experiments help us learn new things
activities: Five-senses station rotation (touch, smell, sight, sound, taste*)
Classroom temperature and weather observation chart
Sink-or-float prediction and test
Draw and label one favorite experiment in a science journal

title: Shapes & Colors
description: Identify and learn about different shapes and colors

content.introduction: In this adventure students meet basic shapes and bright colors through stories, games, and an interactive digital activity.
objectives: Recognize and name square, circle, triangle, and rectangle
Sort objects by shape and by color
Match real-world objects to basic shapes
Use color words to describe objects
activities: Shape show-and-tell with classroom objects
Color sorting using blocks, crayons, or digital tiles
Real-world shape hunt (take pictures or draw examples)
Play the Shapes & Colors Challenge activity in EduAid

title: Music & Rhythm
description: Explore sounds, rhythms, and musical patterns

content.introduction: Students explore beat, tempo, and simple rhythm patterns using clapping, tapping, and digital sound cues.
objectives: Keep a steady beat with clapping or tapping
Recognize fast vs. slow tempo
Repeat and create simple rhythm patterns
Connect rhythm to movement (marching, swaying)
activities: Follow-the-beat clapping game
Echo-rhythm with teacher-created patterns
Create a 4-beat pattern using body percussion
Play the Music Rhythm Challenge activity in EduAid

title: Test Lesson
description: A simple lesson used for testing and demos

content.introduction: Use this lesson to quickly verify navigation, progress saving, and admin content management.
objectives: Open a lesson and view its details
Mark a lesson as completed
Verify that progress is saved after refresh
activities: Read the instructions and mark the lesson complete
Refresh the page to confirm that the status persists

title: Our Emotions
description: Name and recognize four core feelings (happy, sad, angry, scared), understand what causes them, and learn calming strategies.

content.introduction: Learners explore big feelings, what might cause them, and simple ways to calm their bodies and minds.
objectives: Name four core feelings: happy, sad, angry, and scared
Match facial expressions to different emotions
Identify simple triggers that might cause each feeling
Practice a few calming strategies such as deep breathing or counting
activities: Feelings faces matching game
Story time with 'How did they feel?' questions
Create a simple emotions chart for home or class
Practice calming strategies in a 'cool-down' corner
Play the Our Emotions Activity in EduAid
